text:
If you don't mind my saying...
you're in an awfully good mood.
What is the status of the Ancient?
We still have eyes on her.
Is she looking for the promised land?
Is she a higher priority than the materia?
Not her so much as her birthright.
It's a dream of mine to see it with my own eyes.
"It's a dream of mine." How cute.
Oh, come on. You know me.
And I know you, Mr. President─you and your fears.
Still just a child, aren't you?
And under that brattish exterior? Loneliness.
Why would I? It's brought me all this.
Now that's the spirit I'm looking for!
We really need more people like you...
to give the world a shot in the arm.
But what do you truly want?
So, where are we bound this fine day?
Not Corel, that's what. Now step on it!
Very well! South it is! Hold on to your hats!
You act all buddy-buddy, but we don't know a thing about you. Let's fix that.
There's not much to know. I'm a 9-to-5 nobody at a small Shinra subsidiary.
Another paper-shufflin', copy-pastin' forwarder of emails.
But you lot are special. Properly special.
Never met a specialer group of people in all my life!
"How could I not tag along?" Hahaha... Bullshit.
Come now, this is a road trip! We should be bondin', not fightin'!

Promise me...you won't take down Scarlet...
unless I'm there with you.

Alright. I promise...if you don't give up the ghost
right here and now, that is.
I won't let some...stupid car...get the better of me.

Not before I've...punched that witch...
right in the mouth!
Wait! Just─ Just wait! We'll find somewhere to─
Pull over! She's about to pop!
Wait, lassie! Not in the buggy! Not in the buggy!!!

We don't have any leads, and driving in circles,
hoping to spot a black robe is...
When you don't know where life's leading...
Barret! You mentioned somethin' earlier about the Corel reactor, did you not?
You saw a Weapon there, right?
Yeah, but...I don't recall tellin' you.
Well, it might interest you to know that just a wee drive from here, there's another run-down reactor.

Okay! I'm good! Everybody back in the car!
Let's go go...guuh...
Well, couldn't hurt to check it out, I guess.
Aye, just a wee drive from here, so it is... Shall we?
Oh, Cloud? Mind taking the wheel?
Alright! Floor it south through the sands till we start seein' green. We'll be pullin' up outside that reactor before ye can say "mako"!
So, what was up with that "lucky food" fortune? I mean, why mushrooms?
Well, this reactor's smack-bang in the middle of a place famous for─aye, you guessed it!

Mushrooms grown near a reactor?
I'll pass, thanks.
Alright, folks! Keep those eyes peeled!
For a jungle, that's what! The reactor's nestled deep in the heart of one.
If that's the case, I think we're still a long ways off.
Well, we'll soon find out, won't we!
Hey, up ahead. That our jungle?

Indeed it is!
Hold on, Little Miss Carsick, we're almost there!

Bit overgrown for the poor old buggy.
We'll need to carry on on foot.
Oh! I meant to say: there's a village up this way.
Fancy popping in? The reactor's not goin' anywhere, and I'll bet we could all do with a wee catnap, eh?
I just... I feel like I've been here before.
If you're serious about wantin' to be our new best friend, how about givin' us some insider info?
Well, if it's dirty laundry you're after...
I have heard whispers about the new president's "proclivities."
You wouldn't believe how much he spends on those fancy suits!
Ugh! Why did I even ask!?
I know you've been ratting on us to Shinra, telling 'em where we are, you furry fraud!
I knew this cat had two faces!
Ah, come on, now! I'm only pullin' your leg.
Who you kidding? You were literally built by the company. Probably stuffed you full of teeny-tiny listening devices.
The late president believed that bigger was always better. "Small" went against his philosophy.
Knew him well, huh? Some "9-to-5 nobody" you are. Sure your name ain't Stamp?
Come along! The village of Gongaga awaits!
It's about time! I'm freakin' starving.
Maybe our lucky food will be on the menu.
Are these...? They are! Gongaga mushrooms!
They may be hard to come by in Midgar, but here? Here you cannae move for the blasted things!

Nothing. For a second,
I thought you were someone else.

More importantly, why're you here?
Not to survey the reactor, I presume.

Och no, just to study it.
We're on a wee field trip, you see!

And sorry─didn't mean to startle you before.
Just doing our jobs.
You'll get a clear view of the reactor from that hill.
Make sure to pay your respects though.

Our village is a quiet one, as you can tell.
Let's keep it that way.

Don't get a lotta visitors, what with the jungle.
Can't even remember the last time.
But that's part of this place's charm, I s'pose.

Three years ago, the reactor here
suffered a catastrophic failure.
It was old and couldnae handle the stress.
It needed maintenance, which Shinra never provided. And then one day...

This was the company's way of
trying to make amends.
I'm surprised they even made the effort.

And thanks to the hard work of her people,
Gongaga rose from the ashes! Right?

That's nice and all...
but one memorial doesn't buy absolution.
You guys must be tired. I know you've got things to do, but if you wanted to rest up...
My house is just down there.
Got an open-door policy, so feel free.
Woohoo! Don't mind if I do!
I'm, uh...gonna take a look around.

Those Gongaga mushrooms you found?
They're all yours, if you want 'em.
We got more than our fair share.

Didn't settle down here until
after the reactor incident.
Place may not seem like much compared to Midgar, but it's more than enough for me.
That Cissnei lassie was right, y'know.
If Shinra had wanted to, they could've done something about the reactor. But instead, they looked the other way.

Willful negligence killed those people...
And everyone thinks Avalanche are the bad guys. Sad.
Aerith hasnae been herself since we got here, has she. Wonder why. Does she know the place?
I could see myself movin' out here, livin' off the land. Be a nice change of pace.
Just me, Marlene, and our little piece of paradise... Wonder what kinda stuff we'd end up growin'.
"Wonder what kinda stuff we'd end up growin'."
What─'cause it's our "lucky food"? Don't tell me you believe that mumbo jumbo.
Still, you might be onto something. Gongaga mushroom farming sounds like a license to print gil.
Oh? And what makes ya say that?
Now hold on there, SOLDIER boy!
Ya do know they're used in love potions, right?
I ain't playin' matchmaker for ya, son.
Shinra's doin' its damnedest to bleed the planet dry, but she's still got life in her, and we gotta help her keep what's left.

See how they dry their mushrooms here?
Bet they'd make for a mean stock.

Doubt there's much it wouldn't improve.
Soups, pilafs, maybe even a pot roast.
What sorta thing would you go for?
Gonna go with the pot roast.
Gonna go with the pot roast.
Ah, why does that not surprise me.
I remember Mom saying how Claudia's was the best she'd ever had.

If you tell me what it was like,
I could try and make it for you?
Pilaf, I guess. What's in that again?
Well, rice, bit of soup stock... And what else...?

You know what? It's better if you just taste it.
I'll make it for you sometime.
Soup's good. Can't mess it up.

Hey, making a great soup takes hard work,
I'll have you know.

Imagine eating Gongaga mushrooms every day...
Now that's luxury for ya.
Telling species apart can be difficult.

What looks like a Gongaga mushroom
may in fact be poisonous.

For me and my nose, the difference is obvious,
but for someone like you... Well, let's find out.
Which of these do you think they are?
<button=RS> Select the Patch You Believe to Be Gongaga Mushrooms

Correct. I suppose the scent
does make it rather obvious.
That's a variant. While it's not lethal, it'll leave your skin as mottled as its cap.
Don't believe me? Then, by all means, take a bite.
Ones on the left. Anyone with eyes can see that.

So, you've a death wish.
I must say, that's...troubling to learn.
A word of advice, Cloud. Do not, under any circumstances, consume wild mushrooms.
The soil here is exceptionally easy on the paws─as if it exudes life itself.
You wouldn't happen to know our son, would you?
Fine... What did you say his name was?

Our son just up and left one day─
determined to chase his dreams.
At first, he wrote us all the time, but...

When I first saw you, I thought,
"Maybe this is the girl he was always talking about."
Sorry if I made you feel uncomfortable.

I doubt I was the only woman in his life.
Charming guy like Zack...
Wherever he is, I hope he's enjoying himself at least. They do say no news is good news, right?
Say, if you do happen to see Zack, would you tell him that we miss him? And to please get in touch?
We should probably be heading back, don'tcha think?

What, already?
At least have something to eat before you go.
Thanks, but we don't wanna keep our friends waiting.
Sorry. Every time someone says they're from Midgar, we can't help but hope that person knows our son.
Couple of bumpkins like us often forget it's a big city.
Sorry. Just...got caught up in my thoughts.
We ain't got much, but make yourselves at home.

Oh, hello again.
Still no word from Zack, I'm afraid.
Way the world's going, least he could do is drop us a line─let his folks know he's okay.
All this talk of another war has me worried... But I know I'm not the only mother afraid for her son.
Oh, welcome back. You didn't happen to run into Zack, did you?

Forgive me.
I suppose it was a bit of a long shot, but...

I just hope that, wherever he is,
my boy's happy and healthy.
Everyone loves war heroes, don't they? If Zack makes a name for himself, I'm sure we'll get to read all about him in the papers.
Not that I want him to risk his life chasing fame and glory...

You remember me telling you about Zack, right?
At the playground? How...he was my first love.

This is where he grew up.
And now that I'm here, it's...a lot.

So, when I saw someone who looked like him...
I don't know...I had to say something.

Didn't even occur to me to think
how they would feel about it.

Pretty selfish, huh?
Waltzing in there, stirring up memories...

"Pretty selfish, huh?
Waltzing in there, stirring up memories..."
Yeah, you mighta crossed the line.
I dunno...they didn't seem to mind.

You're too hard on yourself.
Bet it was good for them to get it all out.

When you put it that way...
Yeah, you mighta crossed the line...
So, this Zack guy. You still like him?
He's never given me a reason not to...

Leavin' you out in the cold like this...
Forget about that loser.

Then I hate to break it to you,
but if he's been gone this long, the man is de─
Sorry. I'm gonna go lie down.

Well...that clears that up.
He definitely doesn't know who Zack is.
If you wanna visit the reactor, you'll have to get Cissnei's permission first.
I can't let you through without it.

It's coming from the reactor! We gotta check it out!
Wait─do you know something about this?
Could say that, yeah. You been hearin' it for a while?
For a few days now, yeah.
The coalition tried to investigate, but some creatures kept us from getting into the reactor.

Though all they did was fly around, just the sight of those weird black wisps was enough.
More than enough.
Yeah, of course... Why? Do you know what they are?
Well, this just got more interesting.
You, young lady, are on guard duty.

Oh, come on! I just wanna help out!
Be a part of the team!
Yeah, 'cause you've been a real team player.
Keep an eye on her for us.
Let's just get in, take a look, and get out.
Figure you, me, Cait, and Red can do that easy. Agreed?
You guys hold down the fort.
Just head straight south. The guard knows you're coming.
Don't worry: if anything happens, we'll see the villagers to safety.
The captain filled me in. You can head on through.
Just be careful out there. The reactor's a pretty dangerous place...
As if Weapons weren't enough, now the Whispers are back?
Come again? What's a "Whisper" when it's at home?
They appear when destiny is about to be altered, and ensure it maintains its intended course.
I thought we already changed it though.
We did─once. But perhaps now they preside over a new fate. Ours.
And that's what you get for being curious...
It doesn't make sense... How does Cissnei know about the Whispers? Only we should be able to see them.

That's the mako-rich land!
What's good for life is great for reactors!

Whispers...
Though not as we know them.
We must be close by now. How much longer?
We expect to arrive within the hour.
Then I'd better choose a suitable toy.
I'll make sure that it is.
Ach, there's only so much swimming a cat can take!
Why does everything always have to be such a pain in the ass?
More of those things. What a surprise.
Perhaps they want us to follow them?
Well, I dinnae see how, unless we all sprout wings! ...Or raise the water level!
Drainage system activated. Evacuate flooded areas immediately.
Pardon me for asking, but what do you want with this Weapon thing anyway?
We want it to fight alongside us.
Aye, but what for? Who're you looking to use it on?
Sephiroth. And while we're at it, might as well take down Shinra too.
The company I get, but...Sephiroth? The man's been dead for half a decade.
And you'll be seein' him soon enough.
This wee adventure of ours gets stranger by the minute...
Well, now... Would you look at that...
Since the plant went offline, the whole place has been fillin' up with mako!
Which means the planet ain't done! We were right to take out those reactors!
Wha─!? It wasnae me! I swear!
Mako attracts all kinds. Gnats and vermin included.

Thank goodness I had the foresight
to bring some exterminators.
I'd like them killed sometime today if you don't mind! We're on a tight schedule here and that materia won't retrieve itself!
What are you imbeciles doing!? If you don't finish this soon, I'm putting you all on indefinite footstool duty!
I ordered you to squash a few bugs, and you can't even manage that? It's like you want me to exterminate you!
Persistent little pests─too stubborn to die.

When in doubt, fight fire with fire.
Enjoy Hojo's latest "masterpiece."
Yeah? Well, I'm about to choke.
Well, as amusing as this has been...
I have materia to collect, so if you would excuse me.
Relnikhas!? When did those get here!?
Then meet me at the stables!

It's a total mess inside the reactor.
These should help you get around.
Don't ask me why, but my gut is telling me that something big is about to go down.
And more often than not, it's right.
Don't worry. Whatever it is, we can handle it.
We gotta swim across this room too!?
Tally three hostiles. Moving to engage.
She's comin' for your wrinkly hide!
Why not take us on? We'll go easy on you─promise!

Mocking a person's physical appearance
is tacky and beneath me.
Instead, I'll simply carve you all into pieces, bit by bit...
and ground your faces into dust!

Just go! Don't let that hag get
her grubby mitts on my materia!
Come out, come out, wherever you are...
Fly like the gnat you are.
Let that righteous anger guide you.
Cloud, don't let her fool you.
You're not Tifa. You can't be.

We've been over this. I do have a scar.
I showed you, remember?
Those we hate, those we love, those we fear─Jenova would become anyone to fool her prey.
Swim, Tifa! Swim to us! Don't stop!
When we're older, and you're a famous SOLDIER, if I'm ever trapped or in trouble...
Promise you'll come and save me.
That's what heroes do. They save people.
I'm gonna go find my mom.
Then I'm coming with you, Tifa!
Hey, look. Think Cloud wants to come too?
Cloud... Is this... Am I dying?
You're not gonna find your mom here! She's gone!

But not if you give up. You have to want it,
fight for it─hard as you can.
You need to get up now, Tifa.
You can't die here. Too many still depend on you.
Come back to us, Tifa! We've got a fight to finish!
Your words can't reach him now.
Hey, get your shit together! Tifa needs you!

You remember how our parents used to
tell us that when a person died...their spirit
would cross Mt. Nibel?

We all knew it was a story to scare us
outta climbing the mountain.
I didn't... At least, I had my suspicions.

But I buried them. I wanted it to be true so badly.
I didn't wanna think my mom was just...gone.
Plus, Emilio and the others said they'd help me find her, so up the mountain we went.

Some help they were─
running off and leaving you out there.
Not that I knew about any of that...
I hit my head pretty hard when I fell off that cliff.

Think it messed with my memory.
Everything from around that time's a blur.

I only knew what the others told me.
Didn't even occur to me to question them.
They said that you egged me on.
But now I know...that's not what happened at all.
When the rest of them ran...you were there for me.

You stayed when I needed you most.
If that's not a hero...then I don't know what is.
What kinda hero falls off a cliff with the person he's trying to save? And pushes 'em into a pool of mako?
Sometimes...I don't even know who I am.

I forget things everyone else remembers just fine...
and know things I've got no right knowing.
It's like there's different people inside of me.

And the worst part is,
I can't even tell where they end and I begin.
I think that's what's happening to me.
That's not going to happen to you.
You saved me before; now it's my turn.
Aw, worried about little old me?
we got some nasty-lookin' black Whispers goin' up against the planet in the lifestream.
And these Whispers are with Sephiroth, right?

At least, that's how it looked to me
while I was in there.
And? Any idea who was winning? Couldja tell?
Well, of course we are! What did you expect!?
This is the planet we're talkin' about! Y'all know she's gonna pour her heart and soul into this fight!

Just close your eyes and listen.
Tell me you can't hear that─her rallyin' cry!

She knows Sephiroth ain't goin' down easy,
and that she needs others to step up.

But we're the only ones who can, don't you see?
We need to commit─put our lives on the line to save hers!
Wow, what've I walked in on?
You know, there are places better suited to these kinds of conversations.

The home of planetology.
It's right around the corner, isn't it?
'Cause if they do, I am in. Like all in!

Since time immemorial, it has been a place for both planetary energies and ancient wisdom.
Of course we─
Say no more! Let's ride, people!
Wow, Red. What's got you so excited?

That settles it!
We've got ourselves a pilgrimage to make!

While it won't be an easy trek,
this oughta speed things up.
A freeflier pilot works out of an old airstrip nearby. He can take you part of the way.

Use the south gate and follow the trail.
You can't miss it.
He's taken quite a liking to you. Sure he'd be more than happy to give you guys a lift.

And if you need anything else,
just ask around the village.
You're better off heading to the airstrip by chocobo.
Canyon's pretty far. Be prepared for a long journey.
You know, we should probably take a look at the town noticeboard.
See if there are any jobs for us. Always fancied trying my hand as a merc!
I just want to pull my weight─help my pals out where I can, I swear!
Think we can do without your kinda help, ya Shinra bootlicker.
Still can't find it in your heart to trust me, eh?
The way we snuggled up last night, I thought we'd made a breakthrough...
I only did that 'cause I thought you were Marlene! Don't go makin' it weird!
Well, since the republic's on the scrap heap, Shinra all but owns the skies.
Birds oughta count their blessings that Shinra hasn't come down on them yet.
"Freefliers" couldnae care less, though, and go wherever they please!
Good for them! Nobody owns the sky─least of all Shinra.
Bet our man gives 'em the finger as he flies by.
For real!? Sounds like my kinda guy!
Well, looks like we found the airstrip...or what's left of it.
You can say that again! It's more crater than runway!
Are you kidding me? So we came here for nothing!?
Oho, a republic telephone booth, eh? Worth a wee look!

"Send up smoke and we'll be right with you, folks.
─Bronco Airlines."
Yeah, we gotta send up smoke.
Wait, you've never heard of smoke signals? Wow! Whadda they teach you in Midgar?

Well, leave it to someone who knows
more than just "enough"!
But I can speed things up!
Come to me, airplane! Follow the smoke!
Come to me, airplane! Follow the smoke!
Told ya I'd speed things up!
You talk!? The hell kinda magic trick is this?
...Not that I ain't seen crazier shit on my travels.
Now, how many of you we got?
But the old girl likes a challenge.
With hazard pay, I'd say this is fair.

And since I don't have much else goin' on,
I'll be here scratchin' my ass till y'all pony up.
If you got my gil, then we got ourselves a deal.
Just so you know, there's a cancellation fee if y'all decide to back out last minute. Hundred mill per person.
Make up your damn mind already. I'm a busy man.
All this hemmin' and hawin' is gettin' on my nerves, boy.
I'll be scratchin' my ass till y'all pony up.
Waitin' on you folks... I'm a busy man.
Hop on board and sit where I tell ya. Gotta make sure my baby's balanced just so.

Hold on tight now, y'hear!?
Fall out and you're on your own!
No shit, kid! Who d'ya think I am!?
President and pilot of Bronco Airlines─Cid Highwind!
I must admit, I didn't expect to find a willing participant... You are truly a model SOLDIER, my boy.

I'd hold still if I were you.
We wouldn't want any complications.

Since you're so committed,
I'm going to give you a special treatment.
One that will surely make you into a hero.

Once, this would have taken years. But now?
Now it takes a mere eighteen hours!
All thanks to me, and my singular genius.

I stand at the forefront of science─
my brilliance a guiding light!

Of course, we pioneers must be ready
to do what others are not.

Though even I wouldn't dare attempt
to improve upon perfection.

Accursed witch!
Even in death, you would thwart me!
Be still, little puppet. You belong to me now!

Guess I really let all that "genius" crap
go to my head, huh?

After a while, losing became my worst nightmare.
I'd do anything to win.
And look where it got me.
You are not to blame for this.

Evil like that preys on our deepest, darkest fears,
and worms its way into our hearts.
You're the best because you worked your ass off. Not because you're a "genius."

I'd better get back to it.
After all, there can only be one card queen.

So next time you wanna throw down,
you best come prepared.
All's well that ends well, I suppose.
Couldn't have you dying on me just yet.
There are pockets within the Gongaga region that we still cannot scan, despite being within range of a tower.
If anyone is capable of evading detection by republic tech, it must be...
Furthermore, as we have yet to detect a protorelic...
I suspect these issues may be related in some manner.
I've marked the previously mentioned pockets on your map.
And remember: when surveying, safety first!
But I should be able to disable it remotely. One moment...
This appears to be a Shinra training facility─one of several in the region.
Out here in Gongaga? That's news to me.
The official records were curated to remove all mention of them some time ago.
They were last used by...General Affairs, Auditing.
I've created fake IDs for all of you. Now, shall we see what awaits us inside?
Affiliation: General Affairs, Auditing. Subclassification: Turks.
Welcome to the Turks' Training Facility.
As you well know, our duties often require that we enter into high-risk situations.
Failure is tantamount to death. Even here, act as though your lives are on the line.
Without further ado, I'll brief you on your mission.
Kalm's bailey has been breached by armed insurgents, allowing hordes of fiends to overrun the town.
Though our military is on-site, the enemy is utilizing the chaos to establish a foothold.
Our mission is to pinpoint their leader's location and apprehend him as soon as possible.
This exercise will begin as soon as you are ready.
They were faint at best, but I did pick up protorelic readings during that mission briefing just now!
In other words, to secure it, you need only lay waste to your simulated enemies!
Fiends sighted. Attention all units: engage the monster threat.
A swarm of fiends have managed to break through the military barricade.
It's likely that this is the leader's last line of defense. He must be close. Don't let him escape!

Excellent performance.
You'll serve us well in the field.
There is room for improvement, but you performed adequately.
Your performance left much to be desired.
The insurgent leader became radicalized against Shinra following an incident roughly eight years ago.
He believes his home was stolen from him.
There are many who hold grudges against the company, and it is our job to remove these seeds of trouble before they take root.
This facility will enter power-saving mode.

Once you have retrieved your provisions,
proceed to the next location.
While the image is still quite unstable...
The implication is staggering. The protorelic has been digitized and stored within the simulation.
Without more data, I can't say for certain.
Let's head to the next facility. I'll continue my analysis there.
What's this crap about "removing the seeds of trouble"? They really have no idea, do they?
